Name: Steel Column Base Plates, Column 150 plf < W < 300 plf

GeneralInformation.Description: Costing is on a per connection basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
GeneralInformation.Author: Greg Deierlein

DamageStates.Description: Initiation of crack at the fusion line between the column flange and the base plate weld.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: The repair will involve removal of a portion of grade slab, gouging out material surrounding the fracture initiating and re-welding, then repair of slab.

DamageStates.Description: Propagation of brittle crack into column and/or base plate.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Depending on the crack trajectory, the repair will range from replacement of a portion of the column or base plate to full replacement of the column base. Replacement will require shoring of column, torch cutting to remove damaged material, and fabrication

DamageStates.Description: Complete fracture of the column (or column weld) and dislocation of column relative to the base.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Repair would likely involve replacing the entire base plate assembly and most of the column in the story above the base plate.
